description: '''Bleep techno''' (or simply '''bleep''') is a regional [[subgenre]] of [[techno]] which developed in the late 1980s in [[Northern England]], particularly [[Yorkshire]]. Named after its [[Minimal music|minimalistic]] synthesizer sounds, bleep techno combined influences from American techno and [[house music|house]], with [[electro (music)|electro]] elements and heavy [[sub-bass]] inspired by [[reggae sound system|reggae sound system culture]]. The style was commercially successful between 1989 and 1991, and became associated with artists on the [[Sheffield, England|Sheffield]] label [[Warp Records]]. It has been characterized as the first unique British style of [[electronic dance music]].
